com.bigdata.bop

Interface IQueryAttributes

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultQueryAttributes

    public interface IQueryAttributes
    An interface providing access to named attribute values which may be shared across operators or across multiple invocations of the same operator. The bindings are scoped to the owning IQueryContext.

    The key MUST include enough information to provide for the scope of the attribute within the query and is typically the bop identifier plus an attribute name. Bindings DO NOT cross a service partition so it is not necessary to add the shardId or service UUID to the key.

    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson

      Atomically bind an attribute value under the key iff the key is not already bound.
      Object remove(Object key)
      Remove the attribute under the key.
      boolean remove(Object key, Object value)
      Atomically remove the attribute under the key iff it has the given value.

      • get

        Object get(Object key)
        Return the attribute value under the key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key.
        Returns:
        The attribute value under that key -or- null if there is no bound attribute for that key.

        Object put(Object key,
         Object val)
        Bind an attribute under the key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key.
        val - The new value (may not be null).
        Returns:
        The old value.
        See Also:

        Parameters:
        key - The key.
        val - The new value (may not be null).
        Returns:

      • remove

        Remove the attribute under the key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key.
        Returns:

      • remove

        boolean remove(Object key,
             Object value)
        Atomically remove the attribute under the key iff it has the given value.
        Parameters:
        key - The key.
        value - The expected value for that key.
        Returns:
        true iff the entry for that key was removed.
